clues.text: The Toftan soap dispenser is one of several bathroom products this retail giant has named after Swedish bodies of water
No toilet paper needed for your derriere when using this bathroom fixture that's French for "small horse"
Playing Lillian, Maya Rudolph delivers the line "Oh, no, no, no, oh no, I need a bathroom" in this 2011 film comedy
The Baltimore Museum of Art has all-gender restrooms named after this "Hairspray" film director
It's the popular restaurant chain whose restrooms are labeled "Blokes" & "Sheilas"

In April of 2024:
"Only a fortnight til The Tortured Poets Department"

In 2020, almost 30 years after the release of "Home Alone":
"Hey guys, wanna feel old? I'm 40. You're welcome"

After reaching a 2022 deal to acquire Twitter:
"Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in"

In 2024, this athlete with over a billion social media followers:
"Proud to make history as the first top scorer in 4 countries"

Pictured riding a bike hands-free, curly hair flowing behind him:
"My hands are for one thing only: playing sax"
This chief justice of the U.S. moonlighted at his old secretary of state gig for John Adams
Herbert Hoover handled merch in this Cabinet post under Warren Harding & Calvin Coolidge
An ex-presidential candidate himself, he diplomatically followed Hillary Clinton as Obama's secretary of state
Treasury Sec. Salmon P. Chase raised revenue & inflation by printing the U.S. government's first currency, known by this colorful name
Robert Todd Lincoln, who saw his share of bad stuff, was in this president's Cabinet & witnessed his fatal shooting in Washington

rounds.comments: (Ken: You'll name the person responsible for each one.)

clues.text: "Contrary to popular belief, me don't only eat cookies. Me eat three square meals a day... with lots of circular desserts"
"I rewatched 'Office Space' tonight for the 5th time to prepare for @doge!"
"I have to dress Kim every day so she doesn't embarrass me"
"Oh. My. God. I spend my day cleaning & vacuuming & sanitizing everything in the house. I have become Danny Tanner"
"And of course, the film 'Gravity' (2013) should instead have been named 'Zero Gravity"'
This type of tax on imports goes back to Arabic for "notification"
It can mean to mock someone, or to eat voraciously
It's the Hogwarts house that fits the category
In ancient Rome, an ancestor of the English type of this dog breed fought bears, lions & even gladiators in the arena
This word meant any bishop, but now it's specifically the bishop of Rome
This book begins, "Once there were four children whose names were Peter, Susan, Edmund and Lucy"
clues.response: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

clues.text: "Catriona", a sequel to this novel, recounts "The Further Adventures of David Balfour at Home and Abroad"
Published in 1853, "Villette", her last completed novel, tells of a young woman who teaches at a boarding school in the title town
This James Joyce novel ends, "The keys to. Given! A way a lone a last a loved a long the"
This Irish poet & 1995 Nobel laureate won monster praise for his modern translation of "Beowulf"

rounds.category: YOU NEED TO SEE A SPECIALIST

clues.text: A maternal-fetal medicine doctor can judge the wisdom of VBAC, giving birth naturally when you've previously delivered this way
It's thalassemia, so you're short on this protein that carries oxygen in the blood--here's a referral to the hematologist
Meaning related to the elderly, it precedes "medicine" for a specialist who sees a lot of falls & dementia
An epileptologist will know how to treat tonic-clonic seizures, the bad kind also known by this French name
An endocrinologist can treat this insufficiency--the glands of the same name are under-producing hormones like cortisol
Pink outfits are central to this "-core" that got some pop culture heat from a 2023 flick with some real dolls
Involving a paper container, this phrase refers to what someone is after not selling that bad investment, now even worse
Meaning perfectly acceptable, this word from "Simpsons" fame made it into Merriam-Webster in 2023
This online activity of anxiously poring over the sad state of affairs was in full swing in 2024
E.H.E. is short for this type of steamy meteorological happening, all too common now with climate change
Hey there, the song "Delilah" off Queen's album "Innuendo" was named after this man's cat
In a 1900 story a motley crew stumbles upon this character, frozen in position for more than a year
This gym was founded in Venice Beach by a bodybuilder & Navy veteran; I saw it in "Pumping Iron"
According to a study published in 2016, this venomous pit viper was responsible for 39% of snake bites on U.S. kids
This guy behind FiveThirtyEight.com only missed one state in the 2008 presidential election: Indiana
Some truck drivers battle sleepiness with this chemical, the mainstay of NoDoz, Vivarin & 5-hour Energy
Compounds of this element, atomic number 17, can give lifeguards respiratory problems
Sylvia Mackey is the mother of the 88 Plan, which provides aid to retirees who had this job & suffer from dementia
Falls are always a concern for a shingler, a subspecialty of this job
That Siamese in for a checkup may have an asymptomatic Bartonella infection & give the vet this febrile disease
Selina Meyer, on this HBO sitcom: "I will destroy you in ways that are so creative, they will honor me for it at the Kennedy Center"
On the next "Arrested Development"... Jeffrey Tambor was dad to this actor; he, in turn, was dad to Michael Cera
Ilana Glazer, reacting to a man who wants to get married on this comedy: "I'm only 27. What am I, a child bride?"
Benjamin Arthur tagged in as Jake "The Snake" Roberts while Bradley Constant played a "Young" him
As Revolutionary War soldier Nigel Chessum, John Hartman falls in love with the man who killed him on this CBS comedy
"The End" by The Doors plays; a jungle bursts into flames & fades into Captain Willard in Saigon

1996:
Drew Barrymore talks on the phone to a mysterious voice while making popcorn

1981:
The Paramount Pictures mountain fades into a Peruvian peak

2024:
After an egg yolk births a second yolk, Demi Moore's star on the Walk of Fame begins to age
Animated Muses on a Grecian vase come to life & mention the title demigod before singing a gospel-tinged myth primer

rounds.text: Item in common to a January 1889 self-portrait & several of those attending the 2024 Republican National Convention
